Show / Hide Table of Contents

Namespace CatSAT

Classes

Actions

Represents an action that can modify a fluent Actions are functions that map time points, and optionally other arguments to propositions representing that that action has occurred at that time.

Actions.ActionInstantiation

Represents an application of an action to a specific set of arguments at a specific point in time

Actions.SymmetricActionInstantiation

Represents an application of an action to a specifc set of arguments at a specifc point in time

Assertable

Something that can be Assert'ed in a Problem.

Biconditional

Constrains Head and Body to have the same truth value.

Call

Represents a call to a predicate or function with specific arguments. This gets used as the name of the Proposition that the predicate returns when you call it.

CompiledStruct

A CatSAT variable whose value is a normal C# class whose fields are automatically filled in by CatSAT.

CompiledStructType

The VariableType of a CompiledStruct

ConditionAttribute

An attribute representing that the Variable to which it is attached is only defined in solutions for which the specified variable has the specified value.

Conjunction

A conjunction of literals. Used in rule bodies.

ContradictionException

Signifies the Problem contains a contradiction

Domain<T>

Base class for domains of Variables. A Domain defines the set of possible values of a Variable.

DomainAttribute

Annotates a Variable-valued field in a CompiledStruct to specify its domain

DomainVariable<T>

Base class for typed, non-Boolean variables, either for NBSAT or for SMT

EnumDomain<T>

A domain whose values are the values of an enumerated type.

EnumVariable<T>

A finite-domain variable whose domain is a specified enumerated type

Expression

A propositional expression

FDomain<T>

A finite domain defined by a list.

FDVariable<T>

A finite domain variable. FDVariables use an "eager" implementation, meaning there's one proposition in the Problem for every possible value of the variable.

FloatVariable

An float-valued SMT variable

Fluents

Implements propositions and predicates that vary with time.

Fluents.FluentInstantiation

A proposition representing a specific instantiation of a fluid, i.e. the fluid with a particular set of arguments at a particular timepoint.

Implication

States that the Body being true forces the Head to be true without placing any constraint on Body.

Language

Definitions for embedded solver language.

Literal

Represents a Proposition or a Negation.

Member

Represents CatSAT Variable that to be added to all instances of a given CatSAT Struct.

Negation

Represents a negated proposition.

NonTightProblemException

Signifies that a problem contains a circular definition. That is, it contains a proposition that can be inferred from itself.

Problem

A logic program. Contains a set of prositions, rules for the propositions, and general clauses.

Proposition

Represents an unnegated proposition, independent of its value in a given solution.

Random

A fast RNG

Rule

States that Body is a possible justification for the truth of Head. This is different from an implication. An implication says that Body being true forces Head to be true and nothing more. A rule gives the Head completion semantics. It says that the Body being true forces the Head to be true, but also says that the Head being true forces at least one of its rule bodies to be true.

Solution

The output of a program; a model satisfying the clauses of the Problem. Note: for packaging reasons, this is also where the actual solver code lives, rather than in Program.

SpecialProposition

A proposition that involves specialized processing.

Struct

The VariableType (essentially the domain) for CatSAT variables containing other variables

StructVar

A CatSAT Variable that constains over Variables

TheoryProposition

Base class of all propositions used by TheorySolvers.

TheorySolver

A special purpose solver used to find values of TheoryVariables after the main SAT solver has found a partial model.

TheoryVariable<T>

An SMT variable that's solved for by a special-purpose "theory solver"

TimeoutException

Signifies the solver game up. This doesn't mean that the problem is necessarily unsatisfiable (contains a contradiction). It just means that the solver couldn't find a solution in the alloted time.

Variable

Base class for non-Boolean variables

VariableProblemExtensions

Implements various extension methods for Problem that are related to Variables. Also implements a couple of extensions on solutions, when they make the most sense to include here.

VariableType

Base class of all "types" of CatSAT variables. VariableType is a generalization of domains that includes things like the types of CatSAT Structs, that don't really look like domains.

Structs

Interval

A closed inteval over the single-precision floating-point numbers

Problem.TimingData

Statistics for a single performance measurement
